item.title: Molly add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "I don't believe in aging. I believe in forever altering one's aspect to the sun. " -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Molly add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "Far off in the red mangroves an alligator has heaved himself onto a hummock of grass and lies there, studying his poems." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Molly add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Molly add a quote by Philip Pullman
item.description: "I write almost always in the third person, and I don't think the narrator is male or female anyway. They're both, and young and old, and wise and silly, and sceptical and credulous, and innocent and experienced, all at once. Narrators are not even human - they're sprites." -- Philip Pullman

item.title: Molly add a quote by Allan Bloom
item.description: "The failure to read good books both enfeebles the vision and strengthens our most fatal tendency -- the belief that the here and now is all there is." -- Allan Bloom

item.title: Molly add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Molly add a quote by Paul Terry
item.description: "Whenever I feel the need to exercise, I lie down until it goes away." -- Paul Terry

item.title: Molly add a quote by Roberto Bolaño
item.description: "Reading is like thinking, like praying, like talking to a friend, like expressing your ideas, like listening to other people's ideas, like listening to music, like looking at the view, like taking a walk on the beach." -- Roberto Bolaño

item.title: Molly add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott
